1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 // AV.Query is a way to create a list of AV.Objects.
  6 module.exports = function(AV) {
  7   /**
  8    * Creates a new avoscloud AV.Query for the given AV.Object subclass.
  9    * @param objectClass -
 10    *   An instance of a subclass of AV.Object, or a AV className string.
 11    * @class
 12    *
 13    * <p>AV.Query defines a query that is used to fetch AV.Objects. The
 14    * most common use case is finding all objects that match a query through the
 15    * <code>find</code> method. For example, this sample code fetches all objects
 16    * of class <code>MyClass</code>. It calls a different function depending on
 17    * whether the fetch succeeded or not.
 18    *
 19    * <pre>
 20    * var query = new AV.Query(MyClass);
 21    * query.find({
 22    *   success: function(results) {
 23    *     // results is an array of AV.Object.
 24    *   },
 25    *
 26    *   error: function(error) {
 27    *     // error is an instance of AV.Error.
 28    *   }
 29    * });</pre></p>
 30    *
 31    * <p>A AV.Query can also be used to retrieve a single object whose id is
 32    * known, through the get method. For example, this sample code fetches an
 33    * object of class <code>MyClass</code> and id <code>myId</code>. It calls a
 34    * different function depending on whether the fetch succeeded or not.
 35    *
 36    * <pre>
 37    * var query = new AV.Query(MyClass);
 38    * query.get(myId, {
 39    *   success: function(object) {
 40    *     // object is an instance of AV.Object.
 41    *   },
 42    *
 43    *   error: function(object, error) {
 44    *     // error is an instance of AV.Error.
 45    *   }
 46    * });</pre></p>
 47    *
 48    * <p>A AV.Query can also be used to count the number of objects that match
 49    * the query without retrieving all of those objects. For example, this
 50    * sample code counts the number of objects of the class <code>MyClass</code>
 51    * <pre>
 52    * var query = new AV.Query(MyClass);
 53    * query.count({
 54    *   success: function(number) {
 55    *     // There are number instances of MyClass.
 56    *   },
 57    *
 58    *   error: function(error) {
 59    *     // error is an instance of AV.Error.
 60    *   }
 61    * });</pre></p>
 62    */
 63   AV.Query = function(objectClass) {
 64     if (_.isString(objectClass)) {
 65       objectClass = AV.Object._getSubclass(objectClass);
 66     }
 67 
 68     this.objectClass = objectClass;
 69 
 70     this.className = objectClass.prototype.className;
 71 
 72     this._where = {};
 73     this._include = [];
 74     this._limit = -1; // negative limit means, do not send a limit
 75     this._skip = 0;
 76     this._extraOptions = {};
 77   };
 78 
 79   /**
 80    * Constructs a AV.Query that is the OR of the passed in queries.  For
 81    * example:
 82    * <pre>var compoundQuery = AV.Query.or(query1, query2, query3);</pre>
 83    *
 84    * will create a compoundQuery that is an or of the query1, query2, and
 85    * query3.
 86    * @param {...AV.Query} var_args The list of queries to OR.
 87    * @return {AV.Query} The query that is the OR of the passed in queries.
 88    */
 89   AV.Query.or = function() {
 90     var queries = _.toArray(arguments);
 91     var className = null;
 92     AV._arrayEach(queries, function(q) {
 93       if (_.isNull(className)) {
 94         className = q.className;
 95       }
 96 
 97       if (className !== q.className) {
 98         throw "All queries must be for the same class";
 99       }
100     });
101     var query = new AV.Query(className);
102     query._orQuery(queries);
103     return query;
104   };
105 
106   /**
107    * Constructs a AV.Query that is the AND of the passed in queries.  For
108    * example:
109    * <pre>var compoundQuery = AV.Query.and(query1, query2, query3);</pre>
110    *
111    * will create a compoundQuery that is an 'and' of the query1, query2, and
112    * query3.
113    * @param {...AV.Query} var_args The list of queries to AND.
114    * @return {AV.Query} The query that is the AND of the passed in queries.
115    */
116   AV.Query.and = function() {
117     var queries = _.toArray(arguments);
118     var className = null;
119     AV._arrayEach(queries, function(q) {
120       if (_.isNull(className)) {
121         className = q.className;
122       }
123 
124       if (className !== q.className) {
125         throw "All queries must be for the same class";
126       }
127     });
128     var query = new AV.Query(className);
129     query._andQuery(queries);
130     return query;
131   };
132 
133   /**
134    * Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy the CQL.
135    * CQL syntax please see <a href='https://cn.avoscloud.com/docs/cql_guide.html'>CQL Guide.</a>
136    * Either options.success or options.error is called when the find
137    * completes.
138    *
139    * @param {String} cql,  A CQL string, see <a href='https://cn.avoscloud.com/docs/cql_guide.html'>CQL Guide.</a>
140    * @param {Array} pvalues, An array contains placeholder values.
141    * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object,it's optional.
142    * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when
143    * the query completes,it's optional.
144    */
145   AV.Query.doCloudQuery = function(cql, pvalues, options) {
146     var params = { cql: cql };
147     if(_.isArray(pvalues)){
148       params.pvalues = pvalues;
149     } else {
150       options = pvalues;
151     }
152 
153     var request = AV._request("cloudQuery", null, null, 'GET', params);
154     return request.then(function(response) {
155       //query to process results.
156       var query = new AV.Query(response.className);
157       var results = _.map(response.results, function(json) {
158         var obj = query._newObject(response);
159         obj._finishFetch(query._processResult(json), true);
160           return obj;
161       });
162       return {
163         results: results,
164         count:  response.count,
165         className: response.className
166       };
167     })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
168   };
169 
170   AV.Query._extend = AV._extend;
171 
172   AV.Query.prototype = {
173      //hook to iterate result. Added by dennis<xzhuang@avoscloud.com>.
174      _processResult: function(obj){
175         return obj;
176     },
177 
178     /**
179      * Constructs a AV.Object whose id is already known by fetching data from
180      * the server.  Either options.success or options.error is called when the
181      * find completes.
182      *
183      * @param {} objectId The id of the object to be fetched.
184      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
185      */
186     get: function(objectId, options) {
187       if(!objectId) {
188         var errorObject = new AV.Error(AV.Error.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND,
189                                           "Object not found.");
190         return AV.Promise.error(errorObject);
191       }
192 
193       var self = this;
194       self.equalTo('objectId', objectId);
195 
196       return self.first().then(function(response) {
197         if (!AV._.isEmpty(response)) {
198           return response;
199         }
200 
201         var errorObject = new AV.Error(AV.Error.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND,
202                                           "Object not found.");
203         return AV.Promise.error(errorObject);
204 
205       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, null);
206     },
207 
208     /**
209      * Returns a JSON representation of this query.
210      * @return {Object}
211      */
212     toJSON: function() {
213       var params = {
214         where: this._where
215       };
216 
217       if (this._include.length > 0) {
218         params.include = this._include.join(",");
219       }
220       if (this._select) {
221         params.keys = this._select.join(",");
222       }
223       if (this._limit >= 0) {
224         params.limit = this._limit;
225       }
226       if (this._skip > 0) {
227         params.skip = this._skip;
228       }
229       if (this._order !== undefined) {
230         params.order = this._order;
231       }
232 
233       AV._objectEach(this._extraOptions, function(v, k) {
234         params[k] = v;
235       });
236 
237       return params;
238     },
239 
240     _newObject: function(response){
241       var obj;
242       if (response && response.className) {
243         obj = new AV.Object(response.className);
244       } else {
245         obj = new this.objectClass();
246       }
247       return obj;
248     },
249     _createRequest: function(params){
250       return AV._request("classes", this.className, null, "GET",
251                                    params || this.toJSON());
252     },
253 
254     /**
255      * Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy this query.
256      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the find
257      * completes.
258      *
259      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
260      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when
261      * the query completes.
262      */
263     find: function(options) {
264       var self = this;
265 
266       var request = this._createRequest();
267 
268       return request.then(function(response) {
269         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
270           var obj = self._newObject(response);
271           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
272           return obj;
273         });
274       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
275     },
276 
277    /**
278     * Delete objects retrieved by this query.
279     * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
280     *     callbacks.
281     * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
282     *     completes.
283     */
284      destroyAll: function(options){
285        var self = this;
286        return self.find().then(function(objects){
287            return AV.Object.destroyAll(objects);
288        })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
289      },
290 
291     /**
292      * Counts the number of objects that match this query.
293      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the count
294      * completes.
295      *
296      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
297      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the count when
298      * the query completes.
299      */
300     count: function(options) {
301       var params = this.toJSON();
302       params.limit = 0;
303       params.count = 1;
304       var request = this._createRequest(params);
305 
306       return request.then(function(response) {
307         return response.count;
308       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
309     },
310 
311     /**
312      * Retrieves at most one AV.Object that satisfies this query.
313      *
314      * Either options.success or options.error is called when it completes.
315      * success is passed the object if there is one. otherwise, undefined.
316      *
317      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
318      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the object when
319      * the query completes.
320      */
321     first: function(options) {
322       var self = this;
323 
324       var params = this.toJSON();
325       params.limit = 1;
326       var request = this._createRequest(params);
327 
328       return request.then(function(response) {
329         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
330           var obj = self._newObject();
331           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
332           return obj;
333         })[0];
334       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
335     },
336 
337     /**
338      * Returns a new instance of AV.Collection backed by this query.
339      * @return {AV.Collection}
340      */
341     collection: function(items, options) {
342       options = options || {};
343       return new AV.Collection(items, _.extend(options, {
344         model: this._objectClass || this.objectClass,
345         query: this
346       }));
347     },
348 
349     /**
350      * Sets the number of results to skip before returning any results.
351      * This is useful for pagination.
352      * Default is to skip zero results.
353      * @param {Number} n the number of results to skip.
354      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
355      */
356     skip: function(n) {
357       this._skip = n;
358       return this;
359     },
360 
361     /**
362      * Sets the limit of the number of results to return. The default limit is
363      * 100, with a maximum of 1000 results being returned at a time.
364      * @param {Number} n the number of results to limit to.
365      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
366      */
367     limit: function(n) {
368       this._limit = n;
369       return this;
370     },
371 
372     /**
373      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
374      * be equal to the provided value.
375      * @param {String} key The key to check.
376      * @param value The value that the AV.Object must contain.
377      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
378      */
379     equalTo: function(key, value) {
380       this._where[key] = AV._encode(value);
381       return this;
382     },
383 
384     /**
385      * Helper for condition queries
386      */
387     _addCondition: function(key, condition, value) {
388       // Check if we already have a condition
389       if (!this._where[key]) {
390         this._where[key] = {};
391       }
392       this._where[key][condition] = AV._encode(value);
393       return this;
394     },
395 
396     /**
397      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular
398      * <strong>array</strong> key's length to be equal to the provided value.
399      * @param {String} key The array key to check.
400      * @param value The length value.
401      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
402      */
403     sizeEqualTo: function(key, value) {
404       this._addCondition(key, "$size", value);
405     },
406 
407     /**
408      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
409      * be not equal to the provided value.
410      * @param {String} key The key to check.
411      * @param value The value that must not be equalled.
412      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
413      */
414     notEqualTo: function(key, value) {
415       this._addCondition(key, "$ne", value);
416       return this;
417     },
418 
419     /**
420      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
421      * be less than the provided value.
422      * @param {String} key The key to check.
423      * @param value The value that provides an upper bound.
424      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
425      */
426     lessThan: function(key, value) {
427       this._addCondition(key, "$lt", value);
428       return this;
429     },
430 
431     /**
432      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
433      * be greater than the provided value.
434      * @param {String} key The key to check.
435      * @param value The value that provides an lower bound.
436      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
437      */
438     greaterThan: function(key, value) {
439       this._addCondition(key, "$gt", value);
440       return this;
441     },
442 
443     /**
444      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
445      * be less than or equal to the provided value.
446      * @param {String} key The key to check.
447      * @param value The value that provides an upper bound.
448      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
449      */
450     lessThanOrEqualTo: function(key, value) {
451       this._addCondition(key, "$lte", value);
452       return this;
453     },
454 
455     /**
456      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
457      * be greater than or equal to the provided value.
458      * @param {String} key The key to check.
459      * @param value The value that provides an lower bound.
460      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
461      */
462     greaterThanOrEqualTo: function(key, value) {
463       this._addCondition(key, "$gte", value);
464       return this;
465     },
466 
467     /**
468      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
469      * be contained in the provided list of values.
470      * @param {String} key The key to check.
471      * @param {Array} values The values that will match.
472      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
473      */
474     containedIn: function(key, values) {
475       this._addCondition(key, "$in", values);
476       return this;
477     },
478 
479     /**
480      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
481      * not be contained in the provided list of values.
482      * @param {String} key The key to check.
483      * @param {Array} values The values that will not match.
484      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
485      */
486     notContainedIn: function(key, values) {
487       this._addCondition(key, "$nin", values);
488       return this;
489     },
490 
491     /**
492      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
493      * contain each one of the provided list of values.
494      * @param {String} key The key to check.  This key's value must be an array.
495      * @param {Array} values The values that will match.
496      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
497      */
498     containsAll: function(key, values) {
499       this._addCondition(key, "$all", values);
500       return this;
501     },
502 
503 
504     /**
505      * Add a constraint for finding objects that contain the given key.
506      * @param {String} key The key that should exist.
507      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
508      */
509     exists: function(key) {
510       this._addCondition(key, "$exists", true);
511       return this;
512     },
513 
514     /**
515      * Add a constraint for finding objects that do not contain a given key.
516      * @param {String} key The key that should not exist
517      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
518      */
519     doesNotExist: function(key) {
520       this._addCondition(key, "$exists", false);
521       return this;
522     },
523 
524     /**
525      * Add a regular expression constraint for finding string values that match
526      * the provided regular expression.
527      * This may be slow for large datasets.
528      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
529      * @param {RegExp} regex The regular expression pattern to match.
530      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
531      */
532     matches: function(key, regex, modifiers) {
533       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", regex);
534       if (!modifiers) { modifiers = ""; }
535       // Javascript regex options support mig as inline options but store them
536       // as properties of the object. We support mi & should migrate them to
537       // modifiers
538       if (regex.ignoreCase) { modifiers += 'i'; }
539       if (regex.multiline) { modifiers += 'm'; }
540 
541       if (modifiers && modifiers.length) {
542         this._addCondition(key, "$options", modifiers);
543       }
544       return this;
545     },
546 
547     /**
548      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value matches a AV.Query
549      * constraint.
550      * @param {String} key The key that the contains the object to match the
551      *                     query.
552      * @param {AV.Query} query The query that should match.
553      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
554      */
555     matchesQuery: function(key, query) {
556       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
557       queryJSON.className = query.className;
558       this._addCondition(key, "$inQuery", queryJSON);
559       return this;
560     },
561 
562    /**
563      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value not matches a
564      * AV.Query constraint.
565      * @param {String} key The key that the contains the object to match the
566      *                     query.
567      * @param {AV.Query} query The query that should not match.
568      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
569      */
570     doesNotMatchQuery: function(key, query) {
571       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
572       queryJSON.className = query.className;
573       this._addCondition(key, "$notInQuery", queryJSON);
574       return this;
575     },
576 
577 
578     /**
579      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value matches a value in
580      * an object returned by a different AV.Query.
581      * @param {String} key The key that contains the value that is being
582      *                     matched.
583      * @param {String} queryKey The key in the objects returned by the query to
584      *                          match against.
585      * @param {AV.Query} query The query to run.
586      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
587      */
588     matchesKeyInQuery: function(key, queryKey, query) {
589       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
590       queryJSON.className = query.className;
591       this._addCondition(key, "$select",
592                          { key: queryKey, query: queryJSON });
593       return this;
594     },
595 
596     /**
597      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value not match a value in
598      * an object returned by a different AV.Query.
599      * @param {String} key The key that contains the value that is being
600      *                     excluded.
601      * @param {String} queryKey The key in the objects returned by the query to
602      *                          match against.
603      * @param {AV.Query} query The query to run.
604      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
605      */
606     doesNotMatchKeyInQuery: function(key, queryKey, query) {
607       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
608       queryJSON.className = query.className;
609       this._addCondition(key, "$dontSelect",
610                          { key: queryKey, query: queryJSON });
611       return this;
612     },
613 
614     /**
615      * Add constraint that at least one of the passed in queries matches.
616      * @param {Array} queries
617      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
618      */
619     _orQuery: function(queries) {
620       var queryJSON = _.map(queries, function(q) {
621         return q.toJSON().where;
622       });
623 
624       this._where.$or = queryJSON;
625       return this;
626     },
627 
628     /**
629      * Add constraint that both of the passed in queries matches.
630      * @param {Array} queries
631      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
632      */
633     _andQuery: function(queries) {
634       var queryJSON = _.map(queries, function(q) {
635         return q.toJSON().where;
636       });
637 
638       this._where.$and = queryJSON;
639       return this;
640     },
641 
642 
643     /**
644      * Converts a string into a regex that matches it.
645      * Surrounding with \Q .. \E does this, we just need to escape \E's in
646      * the text separately.
647      */
648     _quote: function(s) {
649       return "\\Q" + s.replace("\\E", "\\E\\\\E\\Q") + "\\E";
650     },
651 
652     /**
653      * Add a constraint for finding string values that contain a provided
654      * string.  This may be slow for large datasets.
655      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
656      * @param {String} substring The substring that the value must contain.
657      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
658      */
659     contains: function(key, value) {
660       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", this._quote(value));
661       return this;
662     },
663 
664     /**
665      * Add a constraint for finding string values that start with a provided
666      * string.  This query will use the backend index, so it will be fast even
667      * for large datasets.
668      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
669      * @param {String} prefix The substring that the value must start with.
670      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
671      */
672     startsWith: function(key, value) {
673       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", "^" + this._quote(value));
674       return this;
675     },
676 
677     /**
678      * Add a constraint for finding string values that end with a provided
679      * string.  This will be slow for large datasets.
680      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
681      * @param {String} suffix The substring that the value must end with.
682      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
683      */
684     endsWith: function(key, value) {
685       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", this._quote(value) + "$");
686       return this;
687     },
688 
689     /**
690      * Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key.
691      *
692      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
693      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
694      */
695     ascending: function(key) {
696       this._order = key;
697       return this;
698     },
699 
700   /**
701    * Also sorts the results in ascending order by the given key. The previous sort keys have
702    * precedence over this key.
703    *
704    * @param {String} key The key to order by
705    * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query so you can chain this call.
706    */
707    addAscending: function(key){
708      if(this._order)
709        this._order +=  ','  + key;
710     else
711        this._order = key;
712     return this;
713    },
714 
715     /**
716      * Sorts the results in descending order by the given key.
717      *
718      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
719      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
720      */
721     descending: function(key) {
722       this._order = "-" + key;
723       return this;
724     },
725 
726      /**
727    * Also sorts the results in descending order by the given key. The previous sort keys have
728    * precedence over this key.
729    *
730    * @param {String} key The key to order by
731    * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query so you can chain this call.
732    */
733    addDescending: function(key){
734      if(this._order)
735        this._order += ',-' + key;
736      else
737        this._order = '-' + key;
738      return key;
739    },
740 
741     /**
742      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
743      * values near the point given.
744      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
745      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
746      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
747      */
748     near: function(key, point) {
749       if (!(point instanceof AV.GeoPoint)) {
750         // Try to cast it to a GeoPoint, so that near("loc", [20,30]) works.
751         point = new AV.GeoPoint(point);
752       }
753       this._addCondition(key, "$nearSphere", point);
754       return this;
755     },
756 
757     /**
758      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
759      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
760      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
761      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
762      * @param maxDistance Maximum distance (in radians) of results to return.
763      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
764      */
765     withinRadians: function(key, point, distance) {
766       this.near(key, point);
767       this._addCondition(key, "$maxDistance", distance);
768       return this;
769     },
770 
771     /**
772      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
773      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
774      * Radius of earth used is 3958.8 miles.
775      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
776      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
777      * @param {Number} maxDistance Maximum distance (in miles) of results to
778      *     return.
779      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
780      */
781     withinMiles: function(key, point, distance) {
782       return this.withinRadians(key, point, distance / 3958.8);
783     },
784 
785     /**
786      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
787      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
788      * Radius of earth used is 6371.0 kilometers.
789      * @param {String} key The key that the AV.GeoPoint is stored in.
790      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} point The reference AV.GeoPoint that is used.
791      * @param {Number} maxDistance Maximum distance (in kilometers) of results
792      *     to return.
793      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
794      */
795     withinKilometers: function(key, point, distance) {
796       return this.withinRadians(key, point, distance / 6371.0);
797     },
798 
799     /**
800      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's
801      * coordinates be contained within a given rectangular geographic bounding
802      * box.
803      * @param {String} key The key to be constrained.
804      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} southwest
805      *     The lower-left inclusive corner of the box.
806      * @param {AV.GeoPoint} northeast
807      *     The upper-right inclusive corner of the box.
808      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
809      */
810     withinGeoBox: function(key, southwest, northeast) {
811       if (!(southwest instanceof AV.GeoPoint)) {
812         southwest = new AV.GeoPoint(southwest);
813       }
814       if (!(northeast instanceof AV.GeoPoint)) {
815         northeast = new AV.GeoPoint(northeast);
816       }
817       this._addCondition(key, '$within', { '$box': [southwest, northeast] });
818       return this;
819     },
820 
821     /**
822      * Include nested AV.Objects for the provided key.  You can use dot
823      * notation to specify which fields in the included object are also fetch.
824      * @param {String} key The name of the key to include.
825      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
826      */
827     include: function() {
828       var self = this;
829       AV._arrayEach(arguments, function(key) {
830         if (_.isArray(key)) {
831           self._include = self._include.concat(key);
832         } else {
833           self._include.push(key);
834         }
835       });
836       return this;
837     },
838 
839     /**
840      * Restrict the fields of the returned AV.Objects to include only the
841      * provided keys.  If this is called multiple times, then all of the keys
842      * specified in each of the calls will be included.
843      * @param {Array} keys The names of the keys to include.
844      * @return {AV.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
845      */
846     select: function() {
847       var self = this;
848       this._select = this._select || [];
849       AV._arrayEach(arguments, function(key) {
850         if (_.isArray(key)) {
851           self._select = self._select.concat(key);
852         } else {
853           self._select.push(key);
854         }
855       });
856       return this;
857     },
858 
859     /**
860      * Iterates over each result of a query, calling a callback for each one. If
861      * the callback returns a promise, the iteration will not continue until
862      * that promise has been fulfilled. If the callback returns a rejected
863      * promise, then iteration will stop with that error. The items are
864      * processed in an unspecified order. The query may not have any sort order,
865      * and may not use limit or skip.
866      * @param callback {Function} Callback that will be called with each result
867      *     of the query.
868      * @param options {Object} An optional Backbone-like options object with
869      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
870      *     has finished.
871      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that will be fulfilled once the
872      *     iteration has completed.
873      */
874     each: function(callback, options) {
875       options = options || {};
876 
877       if (this._order || this._skip || (this._limit >= 0)) {
878         var error =
879           "Cannot iterate on a query with sort, skip, or limit.";
880         return AV.Promise.error(error)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
881       }
882 
883       var promise = new AV.Promise();
884 
885       var query = new AV.Query(this.objectClass);
886       // We can override the batch size from the options.
887       // This is undocumented, but useful for testing.
888       query._limit = options.batchSize || 100;
889       query._where = _.clone(this._where);
890       query._include = _.clone(this._include);
891 
892       query.ascending('objectId');
893 
894       var finished = false;
895       return AV.Promise._continueWhile(function() {
896         return !finished;
897 
898       }, function() {
899         return query.find().then(function(results) {
900           var callbacksDone = AV.Promise.as();
901           AV._.each(results, function(result) {
902             callbacksDone = callbacksDone.then(function() {
903               return callback(result);
904             });
905           });
906 
907           return callbacksDone.then(function() {
908             if (results.length >= query._limit) {
909               query.greaterThan("objectId", results[results.length - 1].id);
910             } else {
911               finished = true;
912             }
913           });
914         });
915       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
916     }
917   };
918 
919    AV.FriendShipQuery = AV.Query._extend({
920      _objectClass: AV.User,
921      _newObject: function(){
922       return new AV.User();
923     },
924      _processResult: function(json){
925        if(json && json[this._friendshipTag]) {
926          var user = json[this._friendshipTag];
927          if(user.__type === 'Pointer' && user.className === '_User'){
928            delete user.__type;
929            delete user.className;
930           }
931           return user;
932        } else {
933          return null;
934        }
935     },
936    });
937 };
938
